```markdown
# humanize-ms

Transform human-readable time strings to milliseconds.

[![NPM version][npm-image]][npm-url]
[![Build Status][travis-image]][travis-url]
[![Test Coverage][coveralls-image]][coveralls-url]
[![Gittip][gittip-image]][gittip-url]
[![Dependencies][david-image]][david-url]

[npm-url]: https://npmjs.org/package/humanize-ms

[david-url]: https://david-dm.org/node-modules/humanize-ms


## Installation

```bash
npm install humanize-ms
```

## Usage

Converts human-readable time strings to milliseconds.  It can also accept milliseconds as input directly.

```javascript
const ms = require('humanize-ms');

console.log(ms('1s')); // Output: 1000
console.log(ms(1000)); // Output: 1000
console.log(ms('10h')); // Output: 36000000
console.log(ms('2 days')); //Output: 172800000
```

Handles various time units including:

* **s (seconds)**
* **m (minutes)**
* **h (hours)**
* **d (days)**
* **w (weeks)**
* **mo (months)**
* **y (years)**

## API

The `humanize-ms` module exports a single function:

* **`ms(input)`**: Takes a string or number as input. If a string, parses the string according to supported units. If a number, it's assumed to be milliseconds. Returns the equivalent time in milliseconds.
